thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Rai (Mae Sai); Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai (Doi Suthep, Doi Chiang Dao, Mae Rim); NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Wang Saphung); SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri (Si Racha, Khao Khiao), Chanthaburi (Khao Soi Dao, Wang Kaphae); SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi (Sangkhla Buri, Wangka, Thung Yai Naresuan); PENINSULAR: Yala (Than To).
distribution: Myanmar (type), Vietnam.
ecology: Scattered in evergreen and mixed deciduous forests, 150–600 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chaing Mai (Doi Chiang Dao, Doi Inthanon), Lampang (Chae Son); PENINSULAR: Phangnga (Kapong, Takuapa), Nakhon Si Thammarat (Khao Luang).
distribution: India (Assam – type), Andaman Islands, Indochina.
ecology: Edge of evergreen forests, up to 2,000 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Inthanon, Pha Mon).
distribution: Temperate Himalayas (Kashmir), India (type), Nepal and Indonesia.
ecology: Evergreen forests, near stream, ca 500 m alt. Flowering: March.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao – type: Kerr 5605).
distribution: Endemic.
ecology: Open lowland montane evergreen forests, ca 1,300 m alt. Flowering: June.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima (Khao Si Siat, Chan Tuek).
distribution: India (Assam – type), Myanmar.
ecology: Rocky limestone hill, in evergreen forests, ca 500 m alt. Flowering: September.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai.
distribution: India, Myanmar, China, Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam, Malesia, Japan, (Ryukyus), Taiwan.
ecology: In lower montane evergreen forests, on open slopes, 900–2,200 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao), Lampang (type); NORTH EASTERN: Nakhon Phanom.
distribution: SE China (Hainan), Laos, Vietnam.
ecology: In open evergreen forests, on slopes or by streams, 220–500 m alt.

thailand: Widely cultivated.
distribution: All over tropics, Society Islands (type).
ecology: Lowland forests, often cultivated.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai (Chiang Saen), Mae Hong Son (Mae Surin), Nakhon Sawan (Takhli); NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Phu Kradueng); EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima (Sakaerat); SOUTH-WESTERN: Ratchaburi (Ban Pong); PENINSULAR: Surat Thani (Ko Tao), Nakhon Si Thammarat (Thung Song, Chawang), Trang (Khao Chong), Satun (Ko Adang).
distribution: India (type), Ceylon, Myanmar, Andaman Islands, China (Hainan), Cambodia, Vietnam, Peninsular Malaysia, Java, Celebes, Molucca, the Philippines.
ecology: Common in mixed deciduous and evergreen forests, 50–500 m alt. Widely cultivated.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun, Loei, Khon Kaen; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Ratchaburi, Phetchaburi; CENTRAL: Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok); SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri, Trat; PENINSULAR: Chumphon, Surat Thani, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Trang, Pattani.
distribution: India (type), Bangladesh, Myanmar, China, Cambodia, Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia, the Philippines, Pacific Islands.
ecology: A twiner or trailer often reported from shady spots in diverse forests types, scrub, thickets, as well as roadsides and open grassy areas, near sea level to 950 m alt. Flowering: January, February, October–December; fruiting: February, December.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai; NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun, Loei, Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Nakhon Ratchasima, Buri Ram; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Phetchaburi; CENTRAL: Saraburi, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok); SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri, Chachoengsao, Chon Buri, Rayong; PENINSULAR: Surat Thani, Krabi, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Songkhla, Yala.
distribution: E Africa, India, Sri Lanka, Myanmar, China, Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia, the Philippines, New Guinea, N Australia, Pacific Islands (type an illustration, based on a plant cultivated in England).
ecology: Often found in sunny grassy places such as lawns, pastures, roadsides, campuses, and sometimes in clearings in forests or disturbed areas, dry thorny savannas, 0–300 m alt. An ubiquitous weed in urban waste land and vacant lots. Flowering: April, July, August, October, November; fruiting: January, May, August, October, November.

thailand: EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima, Buri Ram, Roi Et, Yasothon; SOUTH WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok; SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri, Chon Buri; PENINSULAR: Chumphon, Phuket.
distribution: Almost ubiquitous in the tropics: Americas, Africa (type), India, Vietnam, Malesia.
ecology: Sprawling or trailing on damp ground in roadside ditches, muddy pastures, rice paddies, and sunny fields, on clay soil, below 50 m alt. Flowering: July, October–December; fruiting: July, October, November.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Songkhla, Narathiwat.
distribution: Peninsular Malaysia (type).
ecology: In evergreen forests on hills, 250–300 m alt. Flowering: October, November; fruiting: April, August, November.

thailand: NORTHERN: Phitsanulok; NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun, Loei; CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok.
distribution: SW China (type), Laos.
ecology: Clearings and sunny places in seasonal evergreen forests, disturbed margins of evergreen forests, regrowth in burned hardwood forests, in thickets and on roadsides, sandstone substrate, 725–1,300 m alt. Flowering: September, October; fruiting: October.

thailand: NORTHERN: Nakhon Sawan; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei, Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Surin, Si Sa Ket; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Phetchaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; CENTRAL: Saraburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri (Si Racha – type: Kerr 2149, syntypes BM E K; Collins 53, syntypes E K), Rayong.
distribution: Cambodia, Vietnam.
ecology: Formerly in coastal forests and mangrove habitats, now in secondary vegetation and scrub, roadsides, canal banks, in rice fields, pastures, thickets, dry deciduous forests, mixed evergreen-deciduous forests, often on limestone terrain or silty soil, 0–300 (rarely 900) m alt. Flowering: August–November; fruiting: January, September, November, December.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Nakhon Si Thammarat.
distribution: Malaysia (type).
ecology: Thickets on mountain slope, 680–950 m alt. Fruiting: in January.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Nakhon Si Thammarat (Khao Luang NP).
distribution: Malaysia (type).
ecology: Evergreen forests, 200 m alt. Flowering: February.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai.
distribution: Myanmar (type).
ecology: Understorey beneath open grassy forests, 200 m alt. Flowering: October; fruiting: October.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun, Sakhon Nakon, Mukdahan, Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Nakhon Ratchasima, Buri Ram, Surin, Si Sa Ket, Ubon Ratchathani; CENTRAL: Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya, Saraburi, Nakhon Nayok, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok); SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri, Chon Buri, Rayong, Chanthaburi, Trat; PENINSULAR: Chumphon, Ranong, Phangnga, Phuket, Krabi, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Trang, Satun, Songkhla.
distribution: Myanmar (type), possibly Cambodia, Laos, Vietnam, China and Malaysia.
ecology: Dry evergreen forests margins and clearings, in mangroves, grasslands, patches of remnant evergreen forests surrounded by cultivation, secondary regrowths; on diverse soil types: siliceous, clay, sandy, granitic, sandstone, but rarely limestone; ca 30–1,275 m alt. Flowering: January, August–December; fruiting: January–March, October–December.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Lampang; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi.
distribution: NE India, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Bangladesh (type), Myanmar.
ecology: In pristine and in disturbed evergreen hardwood forests, deciduous forests, scrub, on limestone or granitic bedrock, 150–1,550 m alt. Flowering: March, September, October; fruiting: March, April.

thailand: SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Trat; PENINSULAR: Ranong, Trang.
distribution: Bangladesh (type), Peninsular Myanmar.
ecology: Evergreen forests, sea level to ca 200 m alt. Flowering: January, March; fruiting: May.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei.
distribution: NE India, SW China (type), N Myanmar, Vietnam.
ecology: Often on calcareous soils, in clearings of evergreen forests, thickets, scrub jungle, bamboo forests, 300–1,800 m alt. Flowering: January, September–December; fruiting: December.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Nakhon Pathom; CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok; SOUTH EASTERN: Prachin Buri, Chon Buri, Chanthaburi, Trat; PENINSULAR: Chumphon, Phuket, Songkhla.
distribution: Madagascar, India (type, cultivated in Calcutta), Myanmar across SE Asia to Indonesia, the Philippines.
ecology: Often near the sea in coastal provinces, in swampy or marshy areas, or in clearings and along margins in evergreen scrub, or secondary forests, sea level-150 m alt. Flowering: October–December; fruiting: February, November, December.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Lampang, Nakhon Sawan; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei, Sakhon Nakon, Mukdahan; EASTERN: Buri Ram, Roi Et; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Ratchaburi.
distribution: Myanmar, China, Indonesia, the Philippines, New Guinea, N Australia (type).
ecology: Clearings, roadsides, grassy places in dry dipterocarp forests, mixed deciduous forests, fire-influenced dry forests, and rice paddies, 150–380 m alt. Flowering: October, November; fruiting: November.

thailand: EASTERN: Ubon Ratchathani; SOUTH-EASTERN: Sa Kaeo.
distribution: Native in tropical America (type, French Guiana), in Asia, known to be in India and Sri Lanka.
ecology: Along roadsides in agricultural area and vacant, disturbed land, 220–600 m alt. Flowering: January, November; fruiting: January, November.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Lamphun, Lampang, Tak, Sukhothai, Phitsanulok; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei, Nong Khai, Sakhon Nakhon; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Phetchaburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chanthaburi; PENINSULAR: Ranong, Phangnga, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Trang, Narathiwat.
distribution: Nepal, Bhutan, India, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Myanmar, China, Laos, Malaysia, Indonesia (Java – type), Vietnam.
ecology: Sunny areas and clearings in thickets and forests, secondary vegetation, cleared areas, fields, roadsides, reported on limestone-derived soil, 80–1,200 m alt. Flowering: January, February, December; fruiting: January, April.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Phitsanulok; NORTH-EASTERN: Mukdahan; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Ubon Ratchathani; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; CENTRAL: Lop Buri, Saraburi.
distribution: India, Myanmar, Vietnam (type), Indonesia (Java).
ecology: Rampant climber forming vine blankets over trees, thickets, along roadsides in mixed deciduous forests, on limestone or sandstone, 110–400 m alt. Flowering: August–November.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Nan, Lampang, Phrae, Phitsanulok; NORTH-EASTERN: Nong Khai; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Nakhon Ratchasima, Surin, Si Sa Ket, Ubon Ratchathani; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; CENTRAL: Lop Buri, Saraburi, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok); SOUTH-EASTERN: Chachoengsao, Chon Buri, Rayong, Chanthaburi, Trat; PENINSULAR: Chumphon, Ranong, Surat Thani, Phangnga, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Phatthalung, Trang, Songkhla, Yala, Narathiwat.
distribution: Throughout tropical America (type), tropical eastern Africa, Nepal, India, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Myanmar, China, Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam, Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia, the Philippines, New Guinea, Pacific Islands, Australia.
ecology: Clearings, deforestsed areas, and vacant land in villages, mixed deciduous forests, evergreen hill forests, swamp margins, secondary scrub, 25–1,200 m alt. Flowering: January–March, October–December; fruiting: January, February, October, December.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi.
distribution: India, Bhutan, Myanmar. For type, see Notes.
ecology: In clearings, open spaces along streams, roadsides in evergreen and deciduous forests, 400–1,400 m alt. Flowering: January–March, November; fruiting: February, May, November.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Surat Thani, Phuket, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Narathiwat.
distribution: Eastern Africa, Madagascar, Andaman Islands, Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia (Amboina – type), the Philippines, New Guinea, Pacific Islands, Australia (Queensland).
ecology: Margins of evergreen forests, scrub, 1–150 m alt. Flowering: February–April, October–December; fruiting: May.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Phitsanulok; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei, Mukdahan; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima, Buri Ram, Surin, Roi Et, Ubon Ratchathani; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok; SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri, Chachoengsao, Rayong; PENINSULAR: Surat Thani, Krabi, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Songkhla, Narathiwat.
distribution: India (type), Myanmar, Laos, Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia, the Philippines, N Australia.
ecology: Disturbed ground, roadsides, fallow fields, rice paddies, deciduous dipterocarp forests, evergreen forests, and secondary vegetation, 0–550 m alt. Flowering: January, February, April, October–December; fruiting: January, February, October–December.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Rai; NORTH-EASTERN: Maha Sarakham; CENTRAL: Chai Nat, Saraburi, Nonthaburi, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok); PENINSULAR: Satun.
distribution: Sri Lanka, ?Myanmar, China, Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia (Java – type), the Philippines, New Guinea, Pacific Islands, Australia.
ecology: Roadsides and disturbed areas, open clearing in primary evergreen forests on limestone, 0–375 m alt. Flowering: January, November, December; fruiting: December.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Nong Khai, Nakhon Phanom; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima, Ubon Ratchathani; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; CENTRAL: Saraburi; SOUTH EASTERN: Chanthaburi (Krat – type: Kerr 17704, holotype -K, isotype -BK), Trat; PENINSULAR: Chumphon.
distribution: China (Yunnan, ex protologue), Vietnam.
ecology: In open situations, roadsides, or margins of tropical rain forests, gallery forests, bamboo thickets, and shrub thickets, often along streams or near waterfalls, 120–810 m alt. Flowering: January, August, October–December; fruiting: January, October.

thailand: SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Surat Thani; PENINSULAR: Phangnga, Satun (Tarutao Islands).
distribution: India (Andaman Islands), Malaysia, Indonesia (Buru – type), the Philippines, New Guinea, Solomon Islands. Apparently this is a widespread species that is nowhere common.
ecology: Uncommon, on dry hillsides and in grasslands, near sea level 140 m alt. Flowering: January, February, December; fruiting: February.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Mae Wang, Mae Ya falls, Doi Inthanon, Tat Noi).
distribution: NE India, NE Bangladesh, Burma, S China (type), Laos, Vietnam.
ecology: Dry evergreen forests, along stream, to 1,000 m alt.

thailand: SOUTH-EASTERN: Chachoengsao, Chon Buri.
distribution: Peninsular Malaysia, Indonesia (Sumatra – type, Java, Kalimantan?), Lesser Sunda Islands, Papua), Papua New Guinea, Australia.
ecology: Dry evergreen forests, at low altitudes.

thailand: SOUTH-WESTERN: Prachuap Khiri Khan (Sam Roi Yot).
distribution: NE India(?), S China, Laos, Vietnam (type), Cambodia.
ecology: Dry evergreen forests, on limestone, at low altitudes.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai; NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun, Loei; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Nakhon Ratchasima; SOUTH-WESTERN: Phetchaburi; CENTRAL: Saraburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chachoengsao, Chon Buri, Trat; PENINSULAR: Surat Thani, Krabi, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Narathiwat.
distribution: Bhutan, Sikkim, India (NE, Andaman Islands), Bangladesh, Burma, S China, Laos (?), Vietnam, Cambodia, Peninsular Malaysia, Singapore (?), Indonesia (Sumatra, Java – type, Sulawesi), the Philippines.
ecology: Evergreen and dry evergreen forests, to 1,100 m alt.

species_scientific_name: SYC1. Ficus anastomosans Wall. ex Kurz
thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Lamphun, Tak; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; PENINSULAR: Chumphon.
distribution: Burma (type), Indonesia (Sulawesi: near Pankajene).
ecology: Evergreen and dry evergreen forests, on limestone, to 900 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Phayao, Nan, Lampang, Tak; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Phetchaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; CENTRAL: Lop Buri, Saraburi, Nakhon Nayok, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok); SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri, Chanthaburi, Trat; PENINSULAR: Surat Thani, Phangnga, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Trang, Satun, Songkhla, Narathiwat.
distribution: Burma, S China (Yunnan), Laos, Vietnam, Cambodia, Peninsular and Bornean Malaysia, Singapore, Brunei, Indonesia (Sumatra, Java – type, Kalimantan, Sulawesi), the Philippines (Balabac Island).
ecology: Mixed deciduous, deciduous dipterocarp and dry evergreen forests, common along seashore on limestone in evergreen forests, to 1,700 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Nan, Lampang.
distribution: China (Yunnan), Laos (type).
ecology: Dry evergreen and montane forests, to 1,300 m alt.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Narathiwat.
distribution: Peninsular and Bornean Malaysia, Singapore, Brunei, Indonesia (Sumatra – type, Kalimantan).
ecology: Peat swamp forests, at low altitudes.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Narathiwat (Waeng).
distribution: Peninsular Malaysia (type), Indonesia (Sumatra).
ecology: Evergreen forests, at low altitudes.

thailand: NORTHERN: Lampang; SOUTH-WESTERN: Prachuap Khiri Khan; PENINSULAR: Satun.
distribution: Sri Lanka, India (peninsular – type).
ecology: On limestone, at low altitudes.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Nan, Sukhothai, Phitsanulok; NORTH EASTERN: Nong Khai; EASTERN: Amnat Charoen; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi.
distribution: India (type), Bangladesh, Sikkim, Bhutan, Burma, China (Yunnan), Cambodia.
ecology: Dry evergreen forests, mostly along rivers, at low altitudes.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Phayao, Nan, Phrae, Tak; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Phetchaburi; CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri, Trat; PENINSULAR: Phatthalung, Nakhon, Si Thammarat, Satun, Pattani, Yala, Narathiwat.
distribution: Pakistan, N India, Nepal, Sikkim, Bhutan, Burma, S China, Laos, Vietnam (type), Cambodia, Peninsular Malaysia.
ecology: Evergreen, mixed deciduous and montane forests, often near streams, on various substrates, to ca 1,600 m alt.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Narathiwat.
distribution: Peninsular and Bornean Malaysia (type), Brunei, Indonesia (Kalimantan).
ecology: Evergreen forests, at low altitudes.

thailand: Cultivated as an ornamental plant.
distribution: Pakistan, Sri Lanka, India (type), widely cultivated.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Lampang, Phitsanulok; NORTH EASTERN: Loei, Sakon Nakhon, Mukdahan; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Ratchaburi, Phetchaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; CENTRAL: Saraburi, Nakhon Nayok, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok); SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri, Trat; PENINSULAR: Phuket, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Trang, Satun, Songkhla, Narathiwat.
distribution: Pakistan, Nepal, Sikkim, Bhutan, India (type, NE, Andaman Islands), S China, Burma, Laos, Vietnam, Cambodia, Peninsular and Bornean Malaysia, Singapore, Brunei, Indonesia (throughout), the Philippines, Solomon Islands, Australia.
ecology: Dry evergreen and evergreen forests, also on limestone rocks (hemi epilithic?), to 1,300 m; also cultivated.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Tat Noi).
distribution: Sikkim, NE India (type), S China, Burma, Laos, Vietnam.
ecology: Evergreen forests, near streams, ca 1,000 m (elsewhere 500–2,800 m).

ecology: Evergreen forests, to 1,000 m alt.

ecology: Evergreen, dry evergreen and mixed deciduous forests, near streams, to 1,050 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Nan; CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok; SOUTH-EASTERN: Trat; PENINSULAR: Krabi.

ecology: Dry evergreen and mixed deciduous forests, to 550 m alt.

thailand: First introduced by a royal project for cultivated plants in Chachoengsao, then distributed throughout the country.
distribution: Mediterranean to Afghanistan, widely cultivated in subtropical conditions.
ecology: Relatively cool climate conditions.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Tak; NORTH-EASTERN: Khon Kaen; PENINSULAR: Surat Thani, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Songkhla, Yala, Narathiwat.
distribution: Sri Lanka, Burma, Ryukyus, Taiwan, Peninsular and Bornean Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia (Sumatra, Java, Lesser Sunda Islands, Sulawesi, Moluccas, Papua), the Philippines (type), Papua New Guinea.
ecology: Evergreen, dry evergreen and montane forests, to 2,000 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Phayao, Tak; NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun, Loei; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Phetchaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok); SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri; PENINSULAR: Ranong, Phuket, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Trang, Satun, Songkhla, Yala, Narathiwat.

ecology: Evergreen, dry evergreen and deciduous dipterocarp forests, often in rocky places along rivers, to 1,400 m; also cultivated.

ecology: Evergreen forests, to 1,000 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Tak (Umphang – type: Suddee et al. 4426, holotype -BKF).

ecology: Terrestrial growing in humus-rich pockets on limestone in dry deciduous dipterocarp forests, 800–900 m alt. Flowering: April, leaf present from May–September.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Payao (Doi Luang NP), Lamphun, Lampang (Chae Son NP), Phitsanulok (Phu Soi Dao), Kamphaeng Phet; NORTH-EASTERN: Nakhon Phanom, Khon Kaen (Chum Phae); EASTERN: Buri Ram (Khao Phanom Rung), Ubon Rachathani; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri (Ban Bueng), Chanthaburi (Pong Nam Ron); PENINSULAR: Surat Thani (Ban Kop Kaep), Krabi, Satun (Pulau Nipis).
distribution: India, Pakistan, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, S China, Taiwan, Japan (Ryukyus), Myanmar, Andaman Islands, Laos, Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia, the Philippines, Papua New Guinea, Australia, W & SW Pacific Islands (type).
ecology: Terrestrial growing in deep humus or leaf litter over shale, granite or limestone bedrock, in evergreen, deciduous or mixed deciduous forests, and in semi-shade at the edge of secondary forests and scrub, sometimes forming substantial colonies, 100–1,350 m alt. Flowering: April–May, leaf present May–December.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Nan.
distribution: N India (Meghalaya: Khasia Hills), Myanmar, Vietnam, C & S China (type), Taiwan, Ryukyus; 1,000–1,600 m alt.
ecology: In semi-shaded spots in lower montane evergreen forests in moist well drained places. Flowering: October–March.

thailand: NORTHERN: province undisclosed (type: sine coll., cult. Wada s.n., holotype -TNS).
distribution: Vietnam.
ecology: No data available on habitat or altitudinal range. Flowering: recorded in March and April in cultivation.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai (Mae Chedi), Phayao, Nan, Lamphun (Doi Khun Tan NP), Lampang, Tak, Phitsanulok, Nakhon Sawan (Takhli); NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun (Nam Nao), Loei, Mukdahan (Phu Mano); EASTERN: Si Sa Ket, Ubon Ratchathani; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chanthaburi (Khao Soi Dao); PENINSULAR: Krabi, Trang (Thung Khai), Satun (Ban Rao Pla), Narathiwat (Waeng).
distribution: Sri Lanka, India (type), Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Myanmar, Indochina, S China (Yunnan, Jiangxi) and throughout Malesia to the W Pacific Islands (southeast to Tonga).
ecology: seasonal evergreen forests, mixed deciduous forests, dry deciduous dipterocarp forests, hill evergreen forests, savanna forests, pine forests, bamboo thickets, rubber plantations, roadsides and old forests clearings, 100–2,100 m alt. Flowering all year round, but mainly March–June.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Phangnga (Sri Phangnga – type, see above).
distribution: Endemic.
ecology: Tropical evergreen forests with bamboo thickets, ca 200 m alt. Flowering: recorded in November.

thailand: Nakhon Phanom (Phu Langka – type: Suphachadiwong GT 9684, holotype -C).
distribution: Yunnan, Hainan, Vietnam.
ecology: No information available on habitat or altitudinal range. Flowering: March–April in cultivation.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Yala (Betong – Wai 1071 -PSU).
distribution: Peninsular Malaysia (type).
ecology: In deep shade in lower tropical rain forests, ca 550 m alt. Flowering: April.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son (Doi Khun Huai Pong), Chiang Mai, Lamphun (Doi Khun Tan), Phitsanulok; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei.
distribution: NE India (type), Myanmar, Yunnan, Vietnam.
ecology: Seasonal evergreen forests and hill evergreen forests, 750–1,800 m alt. Flowering: January–March.
wfo_full_name: Ania viridifusca (Hook.) Tang & W.T.Wang ex Summerh.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Lamphun (Doi Khun Tan), Phitsanulok (Phu Hin Rong Kla); NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun (Nam Nao), Loei, Udon Thani (Nong Saeng); EASTERN: Chaiyaphum (Ban Thung Kamang); SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri.
distribution: Myanmar (type), S China (Yunnan, Guizhou), Vietnam.
ecology: Seasonal evergreen forests, upper mixed deciduous forests, hill evergreen forests and pine forests, 300–1,300 m alt. Flowering: August–December.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Lamphun (Doi Khun Tan), Phitsanulok (Thung Salaeng Luang); NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun (Nam Nao), Loei (Phu Luang), Nakhon Phanom (Phu Langka); EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima (Khao Yai), Surin; SOUTH-WESTERN: Phetchaburi (Kaeng Krachan); CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok (Khao Yai); SOUTH-EASTERN: Trat (Dan Chumphon); PENINSULAR: Ranong, Songkhla, Yala.
distribution: NE India, Vietnam, Hainan, Taiwan, Peninsular Malaysia (type).
ecology: Tropical rain forests, seasonal evergreen forests and hill evergreen forests, 0–1,500 m alt. Flowering: December–February.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Nakhon Si Thammarat, Narathiwat (Su-ngai Padi).
distribution: Malaysia (Peninsular and Borneo), Singapore, Indonesia (type), the Philippines.
ecology: Evergreen lowland to lower montane forests; 0–1,500 m alt. Flowering all year long, mostly in October–February.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Krabi (Khao Phanom Bencha), Nakhon Si Thammarat (Khao Luang – type: van Beusekom & Phengklai 957, holotype -L, isotypes -BKF C E K P), Pattani (Khao Kalakhiri), Yala (Betong).
distribution: Peninsular Malaysia.
ecology: Evergreen lowland and lower montane forests, sometimes lithophytic on rocks; 800–1,950 m alt. Flowering: February–May, July–August and October.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai (Mae Suai), Nan; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Phu Luang); SOUTH-WESTERN: Phetchaburi (Kaeng Krachan); SOUTH EASTERN: Chanthaburi, Trat.
distribution: Myanmar, Laos, Vietnam, Peninsular Malaysia (type), Sumatra, Borneo.
ecology: Lowland to lower montane forests, also on limestone outcrops; 300–1,850 m alt. Flowering: October–March.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Pattani, Yala.
distribution: Peninsular Malaysia (type), Borneo.
ecology: Lower and medium montane evergreen forests, sometimes lithophytic or terrestrial; 1,000–1,800 m alt. Flowering: December–February and May–September.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Tak.
distribution: Myanmar (type).
ecology: Lowland, hill and ridge forests; 200–1,200 m alt. Flowering: May–June.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai; NORTH-EASTERN: Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum (fide Seidenf., Opera Bot. 124: 15. 1995); SOUTH-WESTERN: Phetchaburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chanthaburi (fide S. Suddee); PENINSULAR: Ranong.
distribution: Myanmar (type), SW China.
ecology: Lithophytic, terrestrial or very rarely epiphytic in deciduous and evergreen forests over limestone, often in rock outcrops; 850–1,950 m alt. Flowering: October–January(–February).

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Nan, Lamphun, Phitsanulok; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei; PENINSULAR: Nakhon Si Thammarat.
distribution: India, Nepal (?type, see S. Thomas, Orchid Monogr. 8: 131. 1997), Myanmar, Laos, Vietnam, S & SE China, Taiwan, Peninsular Malaysia, Java, Lesser Sunda Islands.
ecology: Terrestrial in evergreen forests over granite; 800–1,400 m alt. Flowering: April–July.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Phu Kradueng); SOUTH-EASTERN: Chanthaburi.
distribution: Vietnam (type), S China.
ecology: Terrestrial in evergreen forests; 400–1,300 m alt. Flowering: April–May.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima; SOUTH WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri; PENINSULAR: Nakhon Si Thammarat; UNSPECIFIED: Khao Yai NP (comprising parts of the provinces of Nakhon Ratchasima, Saraburi, Prachin Buri and Nakhon Nayok).
distribution: India, E Himalayas, Bangladesh (type), Myanmar, S & C China, Taiwan, S Japan, Peninsular Malaysia.
ecology: Terrestrial near streams and in bog areas; 100–700 m alt. Flowering: March–April.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Sukhothai; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei, Udon Thani, Nong Khai, Sakon Nakhon; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Nakhon Ratchasima, Si Sa Ket; SOUTH WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok; SOUTH-EASTERN: Sa Kaeo, Prachin Buri, Chanthaburi; PENINSULAR: Ranong, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Satun, Songkhla; UNSPECIFIED: Khao Yai NP (comprising parts of the provinces of Nakhon Ratchasima, Saraburi, Prachin Buri and Nakhon Nayok).
distribution: Myanmar, Cambodia, Laos, Vietnam, Peninsular Malaysia, Java (iconotype), Borneo.
ecology: Terrestrial or occasionally lithophytic in grassy areas in evergreen or deciduous forests, in secondary vegetation and savanna over sandstone, 100–1,200 m alt. Flowering: at different times of the year.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son (Pang Ung – type: Watthana & Wongnak 1863, holotype -QBG).
distribution: Endemic.
ecology: Epiphytic in lower montane rain forests, ca 1,100 m alt. The individuals constituting the only known collection were growing on a dead branch of a tree in a swampy area. Flowering: February–March.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai (Doi Luang), Tak (Doi Hua Mot); SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi.
distribution: Myanmar (type), Cambodia.
ecology: Open places in deciduous dipterocarp forests and lower montane rain forests, 280–1,100 m alt. Flowering: May–August.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Nan (Doi Phu Kha), Lampang, Phitsanulok, Nakhon Sawan; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Phu Luang); EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima (Khao Yai); SOUTH-WESTERN: Uthai Thani (Huai Kha Khaeng), Kanchanaburi (Thong Pha Phum); SOUTH-EASTERN: Chanthaburi, Trat; PENINSULAR: Chumphon, Surat Thani (Ko Pa-ngan), Phangnga, ?Phuket (sine loco – type: Koenig s.n., holotype -LIV, isotype -K), Nakhon Si Thammarat, Satun (Ko Tarutao), Songkhla (Padang Besar), Yala (Betong).
distribution: Nepal, India, Sri Lanka, Bhutan, Myanmar, China, Taiwan, Japan (Ryukyus), Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia, Malaysia, Indonesia, Brunei, the Philippines, New Guinea, Queensland, the SW Pacific Islands.
ecology: Terrestrial on sand, clay or humus-rich soil, sometimes on mossy rocks or in leaf-litter on rocks, tolerates both open and shaded habitats (e.g. grassy road sides, forests edges and wet stream banks in forests). Tropical rain forests, bamboo thickets and hill evergreen forests, 0–2,000 m alt. Flowering: June–July.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Suthep); EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima (Khao Yai).
distribution: Myanmar (type), Laos, Cambodia.
ecology: Growing on trees and rocks in deciduous forests and hill evergreen forests, 500–900 m alt. Flowering: February–April.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Surat Thani (Khun Thale – fide Seidenfaden & Smitinand 1959–1965: 325).
distribution: Peninsular Malaysia (type), Sumatra, Java, Borneo, the Philippines.
ecology: No data are available on habitat, altitudinal distribution or flowering season.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai; SOUTH-WESTERN: Prachuap Khiri Khan; SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri (Khao Yai), Chanthaburi (Khao Soi Dao), Trat (Khao Kuap); PENINSULAR: Phatthalung.
distribution: NE India, Nepal (type), Bhutan, Myanmar, Andaman Islands, Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam, China (Yunnan).
ecology: Growing as an epiphyte in hill evergreen forests, 1,000–1,800 m alt. Flowering: June–July.

thailand: NORTHERN: Tak (Umphang – type: Suddee, Ruengruea, Prommanut & Pansamrong 4433, holotype -BKF).
distribution: Endemic.
ecology: Growing as an epiphyte in dry deciduous dipterocarp forests, 800–900 m alt. Flowering: April–May.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son (Mae Sariang – type: Seisenfaden & Smitinand GT 7728, holotype -C), Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao).
distribution: Myanmar, Laos, Vietnam.
ecology: Growing as an epiphyte in hill evergreen forests and upper montane scrub, 1,500–2,150 m alt. Flowering: mainly July–August, also recorded in October.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Pae Po Mak – type: Seidenfaden & Smitinand GT 7317, holotype -C), Chiang Rai (Doi Tung); NORTH-EASTERN: Loei; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima (Khao Yai), Ubon Ratchathani; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri (between Khao Phra Bat and Noen Phra Metta), Chanthaburi (Phlio Falls).
distribution: N & NE India, Myanmar, Indochina.
ecology: Growing as an epiphyte or lithophyte in upper mixed deciduous forests and hill evergreen forests, 300–1,400 m alt. Flowering: July–September.

thailand: SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; PENINSULAR: Ranong.
distribution: India (type), Burma, S Vietnam.
ecology: In evergreen forests, to 900 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Nan
distribution: China, Vietnam (type).
ecology: In evergreen forests, 1,000–1,700 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Phrae
distribution: India, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Myanmar.
ecology: Mixed forests in mountain valleys.

thailand: PENINSULAR Narathiwat.
distribution: Peninsular Malaysia, Indonesia, Borneo, the Philippines, New Guinea, Melanesia. Type is from India, possibly from a cultivated tree.
ecology: Freshwater peat swamp (in Thailand).

thailand: NORTHERN: Lamphun, Lampang, Phrae, Phitsanulok, Nakhon Sawan; NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; CENTRAL: Saraburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chanthaburi, Trat.
distribution: Indochina, Lower Myanmar, Peninsular Malaysia (type), Indonesia.
ecology: In evergreen and deciduous forests, also in dry dipterocarp forests, locally common, at low altitudes.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Loei; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chonburi, Chanthaburi; PENINSULAR: Krabi, Songkhla, Yala.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Suthep – type: Kerr 694, holotype -K, isotypes -BM P), Chiang Rai, Lampang, Phitsanulok; NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun, Loei, Nong Khai, Sakhon Nakhon, Nakhon Phanom, Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Nakhon Ratchasima, Surin; CENTRAL: Saraburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chachoengsao, Chonburi.
distribution: China, Vietnam, Laos.
ecology: In dry evergreen and mixed deciduous forests, as well as other more open habitats.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Nan, Lamphun, Lampang, Tak, Kamphaeng Phet; SOUTH-WESTERN Kanchanaburi.

ecology: On dry ground or by stream in sunny place, at 400–1,400 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai; NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun, Loei, Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Nakhon Ratchasima; SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri (Krabin).

thailand: NORTHERN: Phitsanulok (Thung Salaeng Luang); NORTH-EASTERN: Nakhon Phanom.
distribution: Nepal, China, Laos, Vietnam (type of
ecology: In mixed forests by stream, at 450 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Nan; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima (Khao Yai NP); SOUTH-WESTERN: Phetchaburi (Kaeng Krachan NP); SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri; PENINSULAR: Yala (Khao Hin Yok), Narathiwat (Khao To-Mo).
distribution: China, India, Indonesia, Malaysia, Vietnam.
ecology: In evergreen forests, edge of seasonal rain forests, in open place, common on slope, 300–600 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Inthanon, Doi Angka).
distribution: S China.
ecology: Common on open place, 1,300–1,820 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: nearly all the year round.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Chom Thong, Doi Inthanon, Doi Suthep, Doi Pui, Huai Nam Dang, Khun Wang), Chiang Rai (Doi Tung), Tak (Ban Musoe), Phitsanulok (Thung Salang Luang); NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Na Haeo); EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima (Khao Yai NP); SOUTH-WESTERN: Phetchaburi (Kaeng Krachan NP); CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok (Mo Singto); PENINSULAR: Nakhon Si Thammarat, Narathiwat.
distribution: Burma, China, India, Indo China, Japan, Malesia, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Australia, Pacific Islands.
ecology: Mixed evergreen-deciduous forests, grassy places by clearings. Common in secondary forests, tropical rain forests, up to 1,500 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: nearly all the year round.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Chom Thong, Doi Chang, Doi Chiang Dao, Doi Inthanon, Doi Suthep, Fang, Mae Rim, Mae Wang), Chiang Rai, Phayao (Doi Luang NP), Lamphun (Doi Khun Tan NP), Lampang (Ngao), Phrae, Phitsanulok (Thung Salang Luang); NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun (Nam Nao), Sakon Nakhon, Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima (Pak Thong Chai); SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; CENTRAL: Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya, Saraburi, Nakhon Nayok (Khao Yai NP); SOUTH-EASTERN: Sa Kaeo, Prachinburi (Khao Yai NP), Chon Buri (Khao Khiao), Chanthaburi (Makham), Trat (Ko Kut); PENINSULAR: Ranong, Surat Thani, Phangnga, Phuket, Nakhon Si Thammarat (Ko Kra), Trang, Satun, Songkhla, Yala, Narathiwat.
distribution: Bangladesh, Bhutan, Burma, China, Indochina, Malaysia, Nepal, Pakistan, India, NE Australia, Tropical E Africa, Madagascar, Pacific Islands.
ecology: In evergreen forests, dry evergreen forests, common in mixed deciduous forests, peat swamp forests and in grasslands, 10–1,600 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: almost all the year round.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Suthep, Fang, Mae Chaem, Mae Sa, Mae Tang), Lampang (Chae Son); EASTERN Nakhon Ratchasima.
distribution: India (type), Bhutan, Bangladesh, Burma, China, Laos, Vietnam, Malesia.
ecology: Evergreen forests, by streams in mixed deciduous forests, in scrub jungle by streams, 400–1,000 m alt. Flowering: December–June; fruiting: January–July.

thailand: NORTHERN: Phitsanulok (Phu Miang); NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun (Phu Hin Rong Kla), Loei (Phu Luang, Phu Kradueng).
distribution: Endemic to Thailand.
ecology: On open areas of sandstone forests, 1,200–1,500 m alt. Flowering: December–May; fruiting: September–November.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chaing Mai (Doi Mon Chong), Tak (Doi Pae Peo).
distribution: Myanmar (type), S China.
ecology: Epiphyte on trees in montane forests, 1,400 m alt. Flowering: March–June.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun (Phu Hin Rong Kla), Loei (Phu Kradueng).
distribution: India (type), Myanmar.
ecology: In open areas of montane forests, 1,300–1,400 m alt. Flowering: March–April.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Inthanon, Doi Suthep, Doi Lang Ka, Pang Tong, San Kamphang, Doi Pha Hom Pok, Mae Klang, Doi Mon Chong), Nan (Doi Phu Kha); EASTERN: Nakhorn Ratchasima (Khao Yai); PENINSULAR: Nakhon Si Thammarat (Na Bon).
distribution: China, Myanmar (type), Cambodia, Vietnam, Peninsular Malaysia.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Phu Kradueng, Phu Luang).

ecology: In open areas in pine-oak forests, 1,045–1,300 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son (near Mo Paeng Falls, Doi Chong), Chiang Mai (Doi Suthep – syntypes of Lactuca parishii : Hosseus 454 -BK E M P; Hoet That to Muong Khu, Doi Inthanon, Pangbo-Khun Khong, along route 109, from Fang to Chiang Rai, Mae Sao Watershed Management Station, Doi Chiang Dao), Chiang Rai (Doi Tung), Lampang (Doi Khun Tan), Phrae (Mae Krai), Tak (Wang Tao); NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Phu Kradueng), Khon Kaen (Phu Khiao); SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi (Khao Kamphaeng, Sisawat, Tham Nam).
distribution: Myanmar (type), China (Yunnan), Vietnam.
ecology: Roadsides in dry dipterocarp forests, bamboo thickets and evergreen forests, 300–1,500 m alt. Flowering: October–December.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hongson (Pang Mapha), Chiang Mai (Mae on, Pha Mon–Sop Ap, Bo Luang, Hot), Lampang (Ngao), Phrae; NORTH-EASTERN: Udon Thani, Khon Kaen (Phu Wiang).
distribution: E India (Bengal – type of
ecology: Gregarious on sandstone rocks along or in streams, 200–960 m alt. Flowering: January–March.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Sop Ap to Pha Mon, Doi Suthep, Doi Chang, Doi Chiang Dao, Wang Tao, Pha Hom Pok), Chiang Rai (Ban San Sa At), Lampang (16 km N of Tak), Phitsanulok (Thung Salaeng Luang NP), Tak (Lansang NP, Ban Musoe); NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Phu Kradueng, Phu Luang); EASTERN: Chaiyaphum (Nam Phrom to Thung Kramang); SOUTH-WESTERN: Prachuap Khiri Khan (Bang Saphan); CENTRAL: Saraburi (to Pak Chong); Nakhon Nayok (Khao Yai NP); SOUTH-EASTERN: Trat (Ko Chang); PENINSULAR: Ranong (Khao Pota Luang Kaeo), Surat Thani (Chong Lom), Trang (Khao Chong Botanic Garden).
distribution: Native from E Asian tropics (Sumatra – type), Malaysia northward Japan.
ecology: On soils derived from limestones and sandstones in deciduous forests, bamboo thickets to open hill evergreen forests with pines-oaks, 0–1,900 m alt. Flowering all year round.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Suthep-Pui, Doi Inthanon, Om Koi, Doi Chang, Fang); NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Phu Kradueng); EASTERN: Chaiyaphum (Nam Phrom); CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok (Khao Yai NP).
distribution: India (type of
ecology: In open tropical rain forests and grassy mountain slopes along edges of light evergreen forests, 600–2,350 m alt. Flowering: nearly all year round.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Suthep-Pui, Doi Inthanon, Doi Chang, Doi Chiang Dao); NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun (Phu Miang), Udon Thani (Chaiyaburi).
distribution: Afghanistan through the Himalaya, SE Asia, Indonesia to Japan (type).
ecology: Poor sandy soils or clayey soils at edges of rice fields in degraded hill evergreen forests, dry exposed mountain slopes, 1,300–2,550 m alt. Flowering: March–October.

thailand: NORTHRN: Chiang Mai (Mae Hoi, Mae Klang), Chiang Rai (Wat Tham Sao Hin Phayanak, Mae Sai), Lampang (Doi Khun Tan); NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun (Kaeng Sopha Falls, Thung Salaeng Luang NP, Nakhonthai); SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi (Muang Kao, Sai Yok, Thong Pha Phum), Ratchaburi (Pak Tawan); CENTRAL: Lop Buri (Khok Samrong), Saraburi (Muak Lek), Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok); SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri (Chakan Arboretum), Chon Buri (Si Racha).
distribution: Tropical Africa, Sri Lanka, India (Madras, New Delhi – type), Myanmar, Cambodia, Vietnam, and scattered through C & S America.
ecology: Waysides near swamps, old rice fields or open grassy slopes in deciduous forests on limestone hills, 10–900 m alt. Flowering: December–March.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son (Pang Mapha), Chiang Mai (Doi Suthep, Doi Inthanon); NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun (Huai Pong), Loei (Sam Hak, Phu Kradueng); SOUTH-WESTERN: Uthai Thani (Katatak).
distribution: Sri Lanka, India, Nepal (type), Bhutan, China (Yunnan), Vietnam, Cambodia, the Philippines, Indonesia (Java).

distribution: Endemic.
ecology: On limestone bedrock in mixed deciduous forests, bamboo forests, 100–800 m alt. Flowering: July–November.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Ang Ka, Doi Saget, Doi Lanka, Doi Lon), Chiang Rai (Doi Pacho, Doi Langka, Khun Chae NP), Nan (Doi Phu Kha), Lampang (Chae Son NP), Uttaradit (Phu Soi Dao), Tak (Doi Hua Mot), Phitsanulok (Thung Salang Luang NP, Phu Hin Rong Kla NP, Na Haeo); NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Phu Tong – type of Hedyotis sessilifolia : Kerr 8838 -BK K TCD), Phu Luang, Phu Ruea NP, Na Haeo), Nong Khai (Si Chiang Mai), Bueng Kan (Bungkla, Phu Wua WS), Sakon Nakhon (Phu Phan), Nakhon Phanom (Phu Langka); EASTERN: Chaiyaphum (Thung Kamang), Nakhon Ratchasima (Khao Yai NP), Ubon Ratchathani (Phu Chong Na Yoi, Khong Chiam, Pa Dong Na Tham, Pha Taem NP); CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok (Khao Yai NP).
distribution: Myanmar (syntypes).
ecology: Evergreens and dry evergreen forests, stream sides, 100–1,800 m alt. Flowering: July–December.

thailand: EASTERN: Amnat Charoen (Kemarat – type: Thorel s.n., syntype -P), Ubon Ratchathani (Khong Chiam).
distribution: Laos, Vietnam (syntype), Cambodia (syntype).
ecology: Dipterocarp forests, open places, 50–200 m alt. Flowering: August–November.

thailand: NORTHERN: Phitsanulok (Thung Nang Phraya); NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Phu Ruea), Khon Kaen (Phu Wiang); EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima (Chan Tuek – type of Hedyotis cytisoides : Kerr 8046 -BK BM K TCD), Si Sa Ket (Khao Phra Wihan NP); SOUTH-WESTERN: Uthai Thani, Phetchaburi (Huai Sai), Prachuap Khiri Khan (Hua Hin – type of H. impedita : Kerr 13433 -BK BM K); SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri (Si Racha).
distribution: Cambodia (syntypes of
ecology: Open places, grassy ground, near sea level. Flowering: October–January; fruiting: November–February.

species_scientific_name: Hedyotis macrophylla Wall. ex Wight et Arn.
thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Bueng Kan (Phu Wua, Bung Khla); PENINSULAR: Chumphon, Ranong (Kapoe), Surat Thani, Nakhon Si Thammarat (Thung Song), Trang (Khao Chong); Satun (Khuan Kalong), Songkhla (Ton Nga Chang WS), Pattani (Khao Kalakhiri).
distribution: Laos, Malay Peninsula (Penang – type), Java.
ecology: Open areas in evergreen forests, 50–600 m alt. Flowering: October–March.
specific_name: Hedyotis macrophylla Wall. ex Wight et Arn.
specific_name_clean: hedyotis macrophylla wall. ex wight et arn.

species_scientific_name: Scleromitrion scabrum (Wall. ex Kurz) Neupane & N.Wikstr.
thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Mae Chan), Nan (Doi Phu Kha NP), Lamphun (Doi Khun Tan), Uttaradit (Phu Soi Dao), Tak (Khao Pha Wo), Phitsanulok (Thung Salang Luang NP); NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun (Nam Nao NP), Loei (Phu Luang WS), Bueng Kan (Phu Wua WS), Nakhon Phanom (Phu Langka); EASTERN: Chaiyaphum (Ban Nam Phrom), Nakhon Ratchasima (Khao Yai NP); SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi (Thong Pha Phum NP).
distribution: India, Bangladesh, Myanmar (type), Laos, Vietnam.
ecology: Dry evergreen and deciduous forests, shaded, 200–1,500 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: July–December.
wfo_full_name: Parainvolucrella scabra (Wall. ex Kurz) M.D.Yuan & R.J.Wang

thailand: SOUTH-WESTERN: Petchaburi; CENTRAL: Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok).
distribution: Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia (type from Java), the Philippines, New Guinea, adventive in tropical Africa and the Americas.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao, Doi Ang Khang), Nan (Doi Phukha NP).
distribution: Upper Myanmar (type) to China (Yunnan).
ecology: Often associated with limestone rocks and cliffs in mixed evergreen and deciduous forests, growing in cracks, in open spots or at the edge of lower montane forests, 1,100–2,100 m alt. Flowering: (July) September–December; fruiting: October–January.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai.
distribution: Upper Myanmar (type) to South-Central China.
ecology: In mixed deciduous forests withDipterocarpus obtusifolius, in open grassy deciduous forests or in open pine forests, mostly growing in poor sandy soil, 1,000–1,300 m alt. Flowering: June–July.

thailand: NORTHERN: Tak (Doi Hua Mot), Phitsanulok; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri (Si Racha), Chanthaburi, Trat; CENTRAL: Saraburi (Muak Lek); SOUTH-WESTERN: Phetchaburi (Kaeng Krachan NP); PENINSULAR: Chumphon, Surat Thani, Trang, Phangnga, Phuket, Nakhon Si Thammarat (Khao Luang), Satun.
distribution: Widespread in tropical Africa including Madagascar, N to S America (type from Jamica) and Asia from Sri Lanka, S India through China to Indochina, Malesia to New Guinea, NE Australia and the Pacific Islands (see Note).
ecology: Open or shaded, damp places in evergreen or partly deciduous forests, also as weed in plantations, 0–1,100 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao – type: Garrett 965, holotype -BKF, isotypes -K L; Doi Ang Khang).
distribution: Endemic.
ecology: Apparently confined to limestone hills, growing in shady and moist areas, 650–2,000 m alt. Flowering: July–August; fruiting: September.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Satun, Pattani, Narathiwat.
distribution: Peninsular Malaysia (Perak – type).
ecology: On moist rocks, often along streams, in evergreen forests, 100–500 m alt. Flowering: July–September; fruiting: August–October.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Nan.
distribution: As for genus (Java – type).
ecology: Shaded, moist, rocky places along streams, 600–1,100 m alt. Fruiting: September.

thailand: SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi (Wangka – type of Ophiorrhiza condensa : Kerr 10436 -ABD BK BM K), Ratchaburi; PENINSULAR: Chumphon, Ranong, Surat Thani (type of O. bambusetorum : Kerr 12383 -ABD BK BM K TCD), Phangnga (type of O. aggregata : Kerr 17212 -ABD BK BM K; type of O. bicolor : Kerr 18480 -ABD BK K), Phuket (type of O. approximata : Kerr 17569 -ABD K), Trang (type of O. longifolia : Kerr 15163 -BK BM K).
distribution: Myanmar, Malay Peninsula (type).
ecology: In mixed evergreen, mixed and bamboo forests, on moist soil and rock in shade, along trails and streams, 150–900 m alt.

distribution: Cambodia, China (Hainan – type), Laos, Vietnam.
ecology: Dry evergreen forests, mostly disturbed areas in moist deciduous forests, margins of dry evergreen forests, ca 300 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: April–August.

distribution: Endemic, known only in the type locality.
ecology: Mixed deciduous forests, 85–100 m alt. Flowering in the rainy season (June–September).

distribution: Peninsular Malaysia, Sumatra, Borneo (type), Ceram.
ecology: Margins and edge areas in dry evergreen forests, below ca 350 m alt. Flowering: March; fruiting: July.

ecology: Lower montane evergreen forests, 900–1,700 m alt. Flowering: April–May; fruiting: September–December.

distribution: Peninsular Malaysia (type).
ecology: Open areas of moist evergreen forests, occasionally in disturbed areas, 60–540 m alt. Flowering: June, August, September, and December; fruiting: February, December.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Phayao, Nan, Lampang, Phitsanulok.
distribution: Myanmar (type), China (Yunnan).
ecology: Evergreen forests of pine, oak, and Lauraceae, 550–1,400 m alt. Flowering: February–March, September, November, December; fruiting: May–June, September–October.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Surat Thani, Nakhon Si Thammarat (Khao Rom – type of Stelechocarpus longipes Craib: Native Collector s.n. [HERB. MRS. ERYL SMITH] 6430, holotype -K, isotype -BK), Trang, Songkhla.
distribution: Endemic.
ecology: Shaded evergreen forests, up to 400 m alt. Flowering: March–May; fruiting: April–August.

thailand: SOUTH-WESTERN: Phetchaburi; PENINSULAR: Ranong (Khlong Kampuam – type of Goniothalamus macrophyllus var. kerrii Bân: Kerr 16887, holotype -BM), Phangnga, Nakhon Si Thammarat (Khao Luang – type of G. macrophyllus var. siamensis J.Sinclair: Smitinand 821, holotype -BKF), Trang, Satun, Songkhla, Yala, Narathiwat.
distribution: Peninsular Malaysia, Singapore, Sumatra, Borneo, Java (type).
ecology: Variably dry or wet, primary and secondary, lowland to submontane forests, with loamy, clay or sandy soils, over granite, sea level to 1,300 m alt. Flowering and fruiting throughout the year.

distribution: Endemic.
ecology: Shady and moist areas of tropical rain forests and forests margins between Para-rubber plantations and remnant rain forests, 100–400 m alt. Flowering: March, April; fruiting: August (based on limited data).
